caption: A hidden gem for Somerville. It is hard to find this style of pizza this far north except montes in Lynn. Really greasy and packed full of flavor. The burnt cheese on the edge hits perfectly. For some people these things might be a turnoff, others not so much. Haven't tried the roast beef yet but that is next.  Update: Got the roast beef. Really good. Heavy on the mayo which I enjoyed. Beef was cooked perfectly. I wish the bun was a little bigger but this was seriously one of the best I've had
Black burned pizaa! I am disappointed How do you even send this to a customer?!
Love the pepperoni pizza with feta, order on line and have never had an issue. Taste delicious every time!

I love Hot Box when it's good but the last 3 or 4 times I've gotten the Roni it's been very inconsistent. Different type of pepperoni every time, sometimes feta some not. It's ok but when I want Hot Box I want those spicy thick pepperoni cups and the feta and everything as advertised. It makes me think twice about ordering from here because even though what I end up with is still ok it's not what I think I'm ordering which is what I really love and want.
Just tried this place for the 1st time. Pizza's great the roast beef though is something else its the best around by far. Definitly be back Would like an au jus option.

Amazing food. Some of the best pizza and roast beef and burgers around. The breakfast burger is one of the best I’ve eaten. Everything there is very good and the staff is super friendly and accommodating.
My favorite pizza is their onion and mushroom pizza, but the cheese is great too.  The senior beef + pickles is a perfect roast beef sandwich.
Fast and efficient pickup service. Whoever was working the counter today (Saturday, December 4) did a bang up job. The food is to die for: absolutely nailed our Massachusetts mainstays!

I've only tried one thing on the menu so far, so I'm reserving that 5th star for now — but they make a mean little pepperoni pizza. I wouldn't have thought to add feta to a plain roni, but it's really nice! And the pizza has a great taste overall, crisp crust, not floppy or soggy, yummy cheese. Love the small slices of roni.  I haven't tried the beef three way yet, but I'm pleased to see someone in Boston doing it right! The North shore beef stylee is really the only good one for what it is, other roast beefs don't compare. Not easy to find a good beef spot in Boston proper — will go here in a heartbeat next time I'm craving one.  Friendly and quick service, too. Thanks Hot Box!

They did their research on these Mass heavy hitters (South Shore style bar pizza and North Shore style Roast Beef 3-ways) and execute amazingly every visit. The beef is rare, the bun is buttered and grilled, the right BBQ sauce (tangy & spicy). The pizza has an amazing crunchy crust and perfect flavor. It's our go to!!
Best
Food was great! The pizza was rich and had a great char to it. The burger was tasty and bigger than I thought it would be based on the price so I was pleasantly surprised.

Pickle Pizza. They have lots of other super delicious foods like the roast beef sandwiches and the grilled crack patty melt, but the pickle pizza will always be my favorite! Walk up order counter or delivery never disappoint.

First time trying South Shore bar pizza. Small, almost personal pan-sized pie; slightly greasy on top; thick, cracker-like crust that holds up as you pick up a slice; a distinct layer of cheese that you can peel back in a single motion. Reminded me of pizza I’ve had as a kid. Nice.  Also got the grilled crack patty melt. Lots of crispy bacon, sweet grilled onions, and gooey cheese. What’s not to love?  We ordered online for takeout but luckily found a table in the communal outdoor dining area. Order was ready on time and staff were wearing masks.
Super beef was indeed beefy and super. Should've taken a pic... But was too busy inhaling it.

I had the "Roni" pizza. The pizza was downright bad. It was way too greasy, soggy and the toppings were scattered and overall Sloppy.  I'm hoping this was just a one-off experience and it's usually not like this. If I get a chance to visit again, I'll update my review.
Better than anything else in Cambridge/Somerville/Boston. So good.

Ok, so let me preface this by saying this pizza used to be BOMB! Crispy crust, high quality cheese, very balanced sauce. I don’t know if it’s an ingredients issue (I suspect cheaper cheese) or poor kitchen staff training, but the last few times I ordered this pizza has been a box of oil and cheese soup. Doughy crust, greasy cheese, and absolutely lava soup in the middle.  I’m more than happy to change this score, but guys-you has a good thing going. Don’t lose that.

I had a few DoorDash delivery drivers steal my Roni order. Not only did Hot Box make me a fresh one, they even gave me an additional pizza on the house due to the inconvenience of me having to go pick it up after ordering it for delivery through Toast. This hospitality was extraordinary. J/Jay (I am unclear of the spelling) professionally communicated with me throughout the entire process. He took the extra steps of kindness even though the stolen pizzas was a problem for their business as well. The most remarkable thing about the situation is that this inconvenience wasn’t even Hot Box’s fault and they still made it right. On top of incredible food, they have incredible service too. I will be a customer for life and spread the word.

Hot Box is one of my favorite pizza places. They have mastered the cheese-to-dough ratio and crispness of their crust. I am a regular customer and I highly recommend giving them a try at their Bow Market location.
My favorite kind of pizza: greasy, saucy and within reach! But seriously, this is the kind of pizza I grew up with and it's just as delicious now as it was then

This rating is for their pizza only. The pepperoni I got was your average greasy pizza. Definitely hit the spot on a cold day. I wish the dough was a little more crispy as I felt my pizza was a bit soggy on the bottom. I've heard great things about their roast beef and wish they had some for me to try that day.

I would give 5 stars because the pizza was really good, however the person running the register was perpetually confused like he had been abducted and told to run the register without any training whatsoever.  I'll be back as long as the service improves.

UPDATE: 02/05 Tell me how the cashier handled my cash and coin with the same gloves that he passed the slice of cheese to the girl making the sandwich? Not to mention I was not handed any napkins with my order. Completely unacceptable  UPDATE: They burnt my pizza crust. The bottom of the pizza was soggy.  Roast beef was dry and tough. Some edges of the meat were beginning to change colours. Wasn’t fresh tasting.  I placed an order via toast tab, received the 'ready’ text and walked to the window to find out someone else named Robert took it.  Now I had to wait for the guy to finagle a rushed sandwich. Minimal mayo, bbq and cheese. Hard to compare experiences with Mike and Patty’s. Best bet is avoid both at all costs after these lousy experiences.

Where do i begin to describe my hot box experience? I want to get hot boxed every day and night. The friendliest staff I’ve ever encountered. I was treated like family. (In a good way not how you experience them on the holidays being badgered about having children of getting married before you’re “too old”) food was excellent . I could have wept with joy from the taste bud party going on in my mouth but decided to save myself some face.i honestly never had a bad meal here. I’d definitely kiss the chef with my food experience. 10 out of Ten. I’m now a regular. Will always stay a regular. Live forever.

I was at first offended by the small size of this pizza, but it is very heavy and was satisfied. Tasty sauce and wonderful crust. We got the onion and mushroom, which was fine, but if I went again I would get plain cheese.
Great food highly recommend
Amazing food amazing service. Brandan and the entire staff are super friendly. Highly recommend trying the place if you like good food
Roast beef sandwich was amazing and there was great service. Good prices and great food!
Food was incredible and the staff was extremely accommodating and friendly, thank you!
My first time there n I absolutely loved the service n food!!! I will definitely be back and I will be letting everyone know!!!

This wonderful Pizza and Roast Beef (with Mike & Patty's breakfast sandwiches served on the weekends!) is situated in the newly opened Bow Market in Somerville. Looks can be deceiving, because while it is only a small takeout window it delivers BIG flavor. The South Shore bar style pizzas are out of this world and have unique flavor combos not available elsewhere (hello Pickle Pizza!). If pizza isn't your thing, then go for the North Shore Roast Beef sandwiches which are lick your fingers good! It's pretty cool that you can do a tour de cuisine of the North and South Shores of Boston all in one shot at this cool little spot!

The Roast beef melts in your mouth. The only way to have a roast beef is a three way and they make it even better with the buttered bun. This place is up there with the best roast beef places on the north shore. Anyone can put a pizza in the oven but they add a dash of love and makes the pizza taste even better with that toasted crust. This place is a must try... 5 Stars... 🖐🏻⭐️🌟
I can't stop eating their roast beef sandwich 😭
username: j u n k y a r d

caption: Staff gave sandwich to another customer while they weren't busy. Waited over 20 minutes for them to remake. Food was ok not the best roast beef.
Great three way beefs and if you try a pizza I would recommend the pickle pizza! It is my new favorite! Never had pickles on pizza before but I have to say I am in love!
Get the pickle pizza!! (Then take it over to Rebel Rebel and enjoy it with a glass of wine.)

Wish I could write a better review, but I had a horrible experience trying to order from here via Seamless--my order never arrived, apparently the driver never showed up and the pizza waited for 40 minutes getting cold. Whoever was manning the phones at the store was nice when I called, but the fact that I wasn't told that the driver had never shown up was... not good.

I was really put off by the service. I ordered online and encountered a bug in their ordering system. When I tried to add a topping to my pizza, the total was correct but the order specified a different topping. I left a note with my order, and trusted that if there was an issue they would be understanding. Instead, when I arrived, the gentleman working there proceeded to lecture me about how I should call or come in person to order, since I clearly couldn't be trusted to order online. After explaining my issue to him and another employee, they told me that they didn't really do "build your own" pizzas, and that I shouldn't try to add toppings in the future.  The pizza was delicious even if they probably spat on it. I can't honestly recommend the establishment, since I don't plan to ever return, but if they had been more polite I would leave 5 stars.
Outstanding beef. And the griddled bun makes every bite have a lil tasty buttery crunch. Its delicious.  update 8/17/19 : still delicious and addictive as all hell. 11/10! highly recomend

Wish I could write a better review for a nice local place, but the pizza was not good. I've always said "you can tell a pizza shop by the quality of their basic cheese pie." Sorry to say it was pretty bad, my wife and I found it hard to finish. Crust kind of chewy, not crispy the way it should be, kind of like when you microwave a piece of pizza rather than putting it in a toaster oven to reheat. The entire edge of the crust was completely burnt - seems like this was intentional as I've seen other reviews with pictures of this, but definitely not appealing to see a thick black ring around the pizza. I wouldn't recommend it and certainly wouldn't go back.

What a concept! Hot Box brings the best comfort foods of both MA’s North & South Shores to one cool walk up window located within a collection of eclectic establishments that make up Bow Market.  The pizza is TDF - to die for! Having spent a few years on the South Shore, they’ve nailed bar style pan pizza. The pickle pizza is incredible, and my favorite.  The roast beef is awesome, high quality ingredients and amazing flavor. The staff is friendly, and I love that Bow Market is dog-friendly, it’s the icing on the cake!
Very solid pizza to go with beers next door at Remnant.
Solid pizza, but not amazing, great ambience in the area though
The pizza is made fresh right in front of you. It's delicious, but not cheap. Its well worth it.
Amazing south shore bar pizza and north shore roast beef!!! Not to be missed on a visit to Bow Market!
Best south shore style bar pizza you can get in the Cambridge/Somerville area.  Greasy, crispy, hedonistic -- super tasty.

Perfectly located next to Remnant! Was great drunchies food. We got the curry poutine and two pizzas. The homemade curry ketchup was amazing!! And the pizza was light and crispy and greasy (the good kind of greasy though.)
I was there today for the first time and had the pickle pizza because a friend recommended to me. Best choice ever!!!! It was nice, crispy and delicious!!!!

THE BEST PIZZA EVER. Honestly it is so good! Each friend that I have brought to Hot Box had doubts and thought I was just exagirating... Then they ate their words with the whole pizza! And now often ask Me to go get more pizza from Hot Box! Ghost pickle pizza is the best one (imho :]), and I love adding mushrooms to it, which has never been a problem to order on-line or in person. The staff is amazing as well, so friendly and professional! Looks like the owners care about their staff and in return the staff cares about the customers. Not to forget, for the quality and the size of their food - the prices are very fair! Also the spot is super cute and who ever did the design for them did an amazing job. Wish I could give more than just 5 stars. #getlit get Hot Box! 💟
They were out of roast beef at like 8pm on a Saturday night so I tried the pizza. It was decent enough but pretty overpriced for what you're getting
Ordered in!  So can't speak to the in-dining experience but thought it was a yummy pie with a great crust.  One star off because the onion/mushroom is a little salty.  The regular was good.

I was at the bar next door to this pizza place (Remnant; dope bar, highly recommend). I ordered my pizza at 7:11pm, was told it'd be 15 mins. At 7:27 I went over and was told it was running behind and would be 10 minutes. I was also told it would be delivered to the bar I was at. At 8:02, I still had to go pick it up even after they said they'd deliver it. It wasn't busy. And the pizza was burnt and about average in quality. If you're in the area, go somewhere else for food.
I can’t get enough of their south shore bar pizza- every single one is amazing, even the dill pickle! Also, the sauce on the roast beef is FIRE. So good and an awesome addition to Somerville.

I was so excited to hear that the owners of Mike & Pattys were opening a new restaurant concept at Bow Market in Somerville! Hot Box is definitely one of the most popular food joints at Bow Market, I mean, who doesn’t want some delicious pizza and roast beef sandwiches?! Talk about comfort food!  I love the pink red/pink neon signs and the overall theme of Hot Box. It’s very “hip” and modern. The staff are extremely friendly and accommodating. Service is efficient.  My personal favorite on their menu would definitely be the pepperoni pizza. It looks and tastes absolutely amazing! I’m such a big fan of thin crust pizzas, but the ones here hit the spot! They also have an interesting pizza where they add pickles to it, and I’m definitely planning on going back to try that.  Everyone needs to check out Hot Box in the Bow Market asap!
The Dill Pickle pizza is a very tasty miricale, if you enjoy Dill Pickels the you cant go wrong with this. Grab a mexican Coke and chill outside if it's warm enough.

Best roast beef sandwiches in Boston, excellent bar style Pizza. Very friendly and talented staff, and located in a great out doors eating environment. Is a must have if you are near summerville or visiting Boston.
All I can say is dankkkk. Get that pizza 🔥🔥🔥
(Translated by Google) FIIIIRREEEE  (Original) FIIIIRREEEE
Hotbox rox. Seriously if you haven’t had this pizza and roast beef, you haven’t truly lived. These people are magicians and I love their social media.
Hot box pizza is the best around
Solid pizza. I can't speak to how it represents south shore pizza, but I liked it. Staff is also friendly!
An amazing elevated version of a South shore bar pizza and equally impressive Northshore style beef sandwiches. Would definitely encourage a visit. 😉😎🔥🍕🍔
